result.execSummary:
The defendant Sharon Joyce Rockman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances unless valid prescription and only taken as prescribed.

Assessment, treatment, counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  

AODA and follow up unless already completed.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sharon Joyce Rockman

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case Called: 2:32 p.m.
Clerk: Nicole.

State appears by ADA Rory McGarry. Atty Julie Lennon appears on behalf of defendant. Defendant FAILS TO APPEAR.

Date and Time Set for a Plea Hearing.

COURT notes defendant was in custody in Shawano County Jail on cash bond.
Atty Lennon is unaware of defendant's whereabouts.
COURT notes proper notice was given for today's hearing.
COURT issues $1,100.00 Bench Warrant.

BFH: 12/16/22 @ 9:00 a.m.

Adj: 2:33 p.m.

RECALLED 2:56 p.m.
Appearances same. Defendant now appears in person.
Parties have reached an agreement.
COURT vacates warrant and BFH.


Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to;
Amend Count 2 (Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor/Repeater) to delete repeater enhancer.
Amend Count 3 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater) to delete repeater enhancer.
COURT grants above;

State moves to 
DRI Count 1 (Bail Jumping Felony/Repeater)
COURT GRANTS.

PLEA: 
Count 2 Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor>>NO CONTEST.
Count 3 Possess Drug Paraphernalia>>NO CONTEST.

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS on both counts: SWH for 1 year probation; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances unless valid prescription and only taken as prescribed; AODA and follow up unless already completed. CC including DNA surcharge. Court grants 3 days credit if revoked.


Adjourned: 3:03 p.m.
Re: Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:14 pm 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Deft is in Shawano County Jail - Atty Julianne Lennon appears on deft's behalf. 
Date and time was set for plea/sentencing hearing. 
Atty Lennon notes she recently learned her client is in Shawano County Jail and requests matter be reset. 
Plea/sentencing hrg reset to 10/24/2022 at 2:30 pm - State to writ deft. 
Adj: 3:15 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Adjourn the Plea and Sentencing
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 7, 2022 at 03:20 pm.

records.addlTxt: Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 2:06 pm 
State appears by ADA Jonathan Barnett; Defendant appears by Zoom Video from MCJ with Atty Peter Vu.  
Reading Waived. Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Prelim Time Limits Waived. 

COURT ORDERS: $1000 signature bond - CONDITIONS: 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening. 

BRANCH 3 CASE. 
PTC with JA: 6/1/2022 at 8:50 am. 
Prelim: 7/5/2022 at 3:20 pm.
